intro: Lithospermum corsonianum, commonly known as the redroot sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly found in the southeastern regions. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in open, sunny environments. Its roots contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Lithospermum corsonianum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native habitat.
